Body:
Description: Dear Team, 

The CAP policy created to block uploads on Github is not working as desired, we expect your support at the earliest as this is priority.

Schedule a call tomorrow asap 09:00 AM onwards (GST timezone).

Thanks!

02Jan: This is from Amy Carlson - head of CS at Netwrix:

We have a new EPP customer, Avrioc Technologies ($31K), having a hard time post-implementation and frustrated mostly with process and lack of transparency. Since September, they have had 25 tickets 6 open escalation tickets and 6 open support tickets remain. The highest priority for the customer is the GitHub ticket 00428361/00430839 the escalation ticket is only 6 days old but the support ticket is over 30. Again, I know this was just submitted between Christmas and NYE but if we can get a status on when this will be resourced for review, I'd appreciate it. It's priority is Critical. 

 

I created a Mgmt Esc for this and provided the above to Cristi H (EPP scrum) for review.

More to follow.

What We've Learned Updated: Our Dev team have prepared a test build for you.  Can we ask you to uninstall the existing EPP client and then retest the scenario with the test build ( EPP client version 6.2.4.0053) on one of the affected machines.  First you will need to uninstall the existing EPP Client version making sure that you also check the option "Remove database and logs". Restart the system, then install version v6.2.4.0053.
Next Steps Updated: TBD based upon customer test results.
Invitation updated. Attendees: Andre Le Roux
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Andre Le Roux, Naveen Kumar
